main_definition: A wound refers to an injury, typically involving a break in the skin or other tissue, caused by external force or violence.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An injury to the body, usually resulting from physical harm
meanings_and_examples.example: She suffered a deep wound on her leg after falling off her bike.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The act of verbally or emotionally hurting someone
meanings_and_examples.example: His harsh words left emotional wounds that took time to heal.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A part of a book, play, poem, etc. where the plot develops and becomes more complex
meanings_and_examples.example: In chapter five, the wound of love between the two main characters deepens.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To tie or bind up something tightly
meanings_and_examples.example: He had to wound his ankle with a makeshift bandage until help arrived.
